This section contains automatically generated API documentation extracted from Python docstrings.

## About Auto-Generated Docs

The documentation in this section is automatically generated using [quartodoc](https://machow.github.io/quartodoc/) from the source code docstrings. This ensures the API reference stays in sync with the actual code.

### How It Works

1. **Docstrings** - Functions and classes have docstrings in NumPy format
2. **quartodoc** - Extracts docstrings and generates Markdown
3. **Quarto** - Renders the Markdown into HTML
4. **GitHub Actions** - Automatically rebuilds when code changes

### Organization

The auto-generated documentation is organized by module:

- **Core Utilities** - Essential utility functions and classes from `utils.blech_utils`
- **Clustering** - Clustering algorithms from `utils.clustering`
- **Ephys Data Analysis** - Electrophysiology analysis tools from `utils.ephys_data`
- **Quality Assurance** - QA tools from `utils.qa_utils`

## Navigation

Use the sidebar to browse the auto-generated API documentation. Each function and class has:

- **Signature** - Function/class signature with parameters
- **Parameters** - Detailed parameter descriptions
- **Returns** - Return value descriptions
- **Examples** - Usage examples (when available)
- **See Also** - Related functions and classes

## Contributing

To improve the auto-generated documentation:

1. **Update docstrings** in the source code (`.py` files)
2. **Follow NumPy docstring format** - See [NumPy Style Guide](https://numpydoc.readthedocs.io/en/latest/format.html)
3. **Rebuild docs** - Run `quartodoc build` in the `docs/` directory
4. **Preview changes** - Run `quarto preview` to see the results

See [docs/README.md](https://github.com/katzlabbrandeis/blech_clust/blob/master/docs/README.md) for detailed instructions.
